intro: Lasiorrhiza canescens, commonly known as the woolly bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
